column2: Varuna Integrated Logistics Pvt. Ltd is looking for Executive - Fleet Operations to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey           Fleet Management Strategy    : Develop and implement strategic plans and objectives for fleet management in alignment with the organization's goals and objectives. This includes defining fleet size, composition, and utilization targets.                Vehicle Acquisition and Disposal    : Oversee the acquisition, replacement, and disposal of vehicles in the fleet. This involves selecting appropriate vehicle models, negotiating purchase or lease agreements, and managing the resale or disposal process for retiring vehicles.                Maintenance and Repairs    : Develop and implement maintenance schedules and procedures to ensure the safety, reliability, and efficiency of fleet vehicles. Coordinate with maintenance providers, repair facilities, and service technicians to perform routine maintenance and address mechanical issues promptly.                Fuel Management    : Implement strategies to optimize fuel consumption and reduce fuel costs across the fleet. This may include monitoring fuel usage, implementing fuel efficiency measures, and negotiating fuel supply contracts to secure favorable pricing.                Driver Management    : Oversee driver selection, training, and performance management to ensure compliance with safety regulations, company policies, and industry best practices. Implement driver training programs, safety initiatives, and performance monitoring systems to promote safe driving behaviors and minimize accidents.                Compliance and Regulatory Affairs    : Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, laws, and industry standards governing fleet operations, including vehicle registration, licensing, insurance, and environmental regulations. Stay updated on changes in regulations and proactively implement necessary adjustments to maintain compliance.

Roles and Responsibilities: Route Planning - Plan different routes Fleet Management, Vendor Management, Inventory Control. Compliance and Regulation, Cost Management, Risk Management, Customer Service. Performance Tracking, Continuous Improvement. Required Candidate profile People from steel industry background are preferred but someone with similar experience will also be considered. Three days training will be provided in the warehouse.
column11: Fleet Management, Route Planning, Customer Service, Stock Management, Transport Management, Transport Operations

column2: We are seeking a Fleet Manager to handle the fleet management of Drishti Marine by overviewing & managing the upkeep of boats owned by Drishti including engines and electrical components.     The role will report to the Sr. Manager Technical / COO, based out of Goa.               Responsibilities and Duties           Coordination with various Drishti departments working at yard         Fleet management         Handle Out board engines and jet skis used at yard together with track of non ops items         Ensure maintenance of Log Books for all defects/ rectifications, engine/ genset running hours to be recorded for every trip onboard various boats         Ensure upkeep and maintenance of boats         Ensure crew hygiene, neat/ clean uniform of the crew embarking the boats         Ensure maintain Ops Status of boats and should update HOD twice a day (0830 hrs and 1800 hrs)         Ensure Safe berthing/ mooring of boats         Ensure hygiene onboard all boats and make random checks          Ensure pest control onboard all boats and log to be maintained for the same         Ensure hourly routines on all engines as per OEM         Yard requirements in terms of infrastructure mechanical and electrical         Operation of jack ups         Overview and supervision of maintenance on jack ups         Supervision Contractors working at yard         Any other responsibilities entrusted by HOD           Qualifications, Experience & Skill requirements:           Degree in logistics or 2+ years in a logistics role         Experience in the transportation industry         Outstanding organisational skills         Analytical mindset and good problem-solving skills         Good written and verbal communication

column2: As a Fleet Operations Manager at Alt Mobility, you will play a crucial role in implementing and maintaining fleet operations to drive operational efficiency, Fleet health & Utilisation and informed decision-making across the organisation. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and utilisation of technology-driven solutions.                       ?       Responsibilities:                Collaborate with different OEM s for service data & analyse different parameters like TAT , cost , job type etc.     Handling the Road Side Assistance (RSA) support system for accident & breakdown vehicles.     Handling end to end operations for new vehicles procurement i.e placing order to delivery     Handling Insurance Claim Management & liaising with Insurance companies.     Asset utilisation check along with all related parameters around it.     Handling insurance claims process for fleet vehicles.     Physical health check of the vehicles & come up with the findings of repairs required.     Analysis of the life cycle data of the vehicles & the repairs of the vehicle as per the services done & the requirements.     Taking care of refurbishments/repairs of the vehicles for re-deploying in the market                  Qualifications:                 Bachelors degree in Mechanical, Automobile or related field.     3 - 5 years of experience in managing fleet operations.     Strong knowledge on the automobiles especially electric vehicles & support systems would be preferred     Experience in implementing and managing practical issues in the fleet operations     Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyse complex issues and develop effective solutions.     Attention to detail and commitment to fleet management     Ability to adapt to a fast-paced startup environment and navigate ambiguity.

column2: Hi, We are hiring  for the role of? Transport Coordinato r for the  FMCG MNC , position based at? Kothur Mandal, Hyderabad ?- plant.  You'll be hired on the payroll of?Ashkom Media India Pvt. Ltd. Kindly go through the attached JD and if interested revert me back with your feedback and updated resume. Need immediate joiner  JOB DESCRIPTION Designation : Transport Coordinator Location : Kothur Mandal - Hyderabad Qualification : Any Graduate Basic Requirement - SAP, MS - Excel Job Description Monitoring a high volume of inbound and outbound shipments including reverse logistics. Maintain relationships with logistics partners and customers. Provide exceptional customer service to customers and logistics partners. Solve customer and logistics partner problems and help resolve issues. Monitoring and maintaining performance reports for logistics partners as well as for customers. Ensure to have a correct update in the MIS report supporting the billing team to share correct data. Be a professional representative of our company that other employees look up to. Plan delivery routes. Dispatch drivers to complete deliveries. Record shipment details on the computer system. Review driver logs. Respond to client feedback or complaints. Responsible for the activities associated with the transportation of products from suppliers into the network. Optimize transport planning in the most efficient way for customers and stakeholders Maintain proper and accurate Pre-Shipment and Post-Shipment Administration Track and Trace Proof of Delivery Over, short, and damaged shipment issues Evaluates, records, and responds to additional/special service requests (i.e. lift-gate, inside delivery, etc.) Work with transportation providers and freight payment team to ensure proper accessorial cost and flows Handle damage and loss claims Assists in troubleshooting and resolving safety, service, and operational issues Ensure correct estimates in transport planning system Meet on time delivery (OTD) requirements and follow on discrepancies with suppliers and Customer Service Stakeholder management; adequately and proactively inform Customer Service departments, Global Service Centres, and suppliers.
